newsitem.title: UK: UK by-election to be held on December 12.
newsitem.headline: UK by-election to be held on December 12.

text.p: The by-election in the safe Labour seat of Barnsley East, caused by the death of Labour MP Terry Patchett, will be on December 12, parliament heard on Wednesday.
Labour had a majority of 24,777 in the seat at the 1992 general election.

Another seat, Wirral South, is also vacant after the death of Conservative Barry Porter in November. In the seat the government had a 1992 majority of 8,183. Major is also expected to call the Wirral South byelection on December 12.
A government victory would maintain the status quo but defeat would cost Prime Minister John Major his one seat majority in the house.
